file_content.text: That was amazing! Outnumbered, outgunned--but those Imperials never stood a chance!
If you hadn't come here... We owe you our lives.
Pak? How did you see that?
Saw the whole fight on the security holo. Pretty incredible, and I've seen some good fights.
Remind me not to leave you alone with any prisoners.
That's pretty gruesome, even for you.
We'll stay here until Republic reinforcements regain control of the prison.
I don't need compliments--I need to know where Executor Krannus went.
Thanks, but we're in trouble.
I wish they would have surrendered, but Krannus's troops are determined to fight to the death.
I didn't want to kill them.
Just wait until I get my hands on Krannus--then you'll see something really impressive.
That's what I do.
Krannus is what the Imperials called their leader. He took Doctor Gantrell.
Took him? His tracking chip says he's right there.
The Sith carved it out of the Doctor's skin and threw it in the corner--he screamed the whole time.
Do you know where they were headed?
I need to find them.
What kind of monster butchers a helpless prisoner like that?
That's barbaric.
The kind who wants to wipe out an entire planet.
The kind who plans to destroy a planet.
Torturing a prisoner is nothing to someone who would exterminate entire worlds.
The tracking chip was an obstacle. He removed it to maximize his odds of mission success.
Krannus = ruthless // Jedi + T7 = stop him
I would have done the same thing if I didn't want my prisoner tracked.
Smart.
Krannus may be a fanatic, but he's no fool.
Removing prisoner tracking chips is standard operating procedure. I usually give them something for the pain.
Removing chip = torture // Torture = forbidden by Jedi Code
You have to find Doctor Gantrell. Our project is too important to fall into enemy hands!
It'd be a lot easier to find him if you know where they're going.
Then tell me where they went.
I think you'd better tell me what your team's been up to.
What were you working on?
We're studying unknown alien technology in the prison's lower levels. The power core alone is astonishingly complex.
Give me the location of the research vault.
I'd better go save the doctor.
I thought the Republic built this prison complex.
This isn't our technology?
No, only the upper levels. The rest was built thousands of years ago. We stumbled across it by accident and claimed it for ourselves.
There are still sealed containment vaults we haven't even opened yet.
We've only just started examining the power core, but the energy it produces seems almost limitless.
If Krannus gets to that power core, what's the worst he could do?
And now the Sith are after it.
Could Krannus use the power core as a weapon to destroy Belsavis?
They're headed for the core.
Krannus wouldn't drag a prisoner around without a good reason.
They must need the doctor.
The Imperials demanded access to the prison's power core, but those levels are sealed.
There's only one key to the core, and we secure it inside the main research vault. Only Doctor Gantrell can open it.
Give me the location.
Where's the research vault?
If they need Doctor Gantrell for the code, they won't kill him.
That means he's still alive.
Doctor Gantrell's a brilliant scientist, but he's not a brave man. He'll give them the key.
Krannus wants to wipe out all life on Belsavis. Is it possible to do that using the power core?
The core sounds dangerous.
He wants to what? That... that's insane!
Yes. But is it possible?
If the core was breached, the resulting blast would rip Belsavis apart. But the Imperials would be killed, too!
All we have to do is find Krannus before he gets that key from the research vault.
Now I know Krannus's plan.
That's why the Emperor sent Krannus's death cult. We need to catch them before Doctor Gantrell gives up the key to the power core.
They're suicidal fanatics.
All this conversation isn't going to stop Krannus.
We're running out of time.
The research vault's inside the maximum security wing. Punch this access code into the security terminal when you get there.
Wait--there's more. Our team created a number of advanced warfare prototypes by combining Republic and alien technology.
When the Empire attacked, we hid the weapons in one of the vaults near the Republic settlement. If the prisoners find them....
I think I can spare a few minutes to keep deadly weapons out of criminal hands.
They won't.
You'll be saving thousands of people.
Advanced prototypes? Just how advanced are we talking?
How bad could it get?
This is cutting-edge research. Massive destructive potential.
The only thing I care about is stopping Krannus.
I've got bigger problems.
It's hard enough putting down this riot. If the prisoners have advanced weaponry, thousands could die!
No offense, but I'm a lot more worried about the crazy Imperial trying to destroy the planet... with me still on it.
As bad as that sounds, Krannus is worse.
Those lives are meaningless. Stopping Krannus is all that matters.
A secondary objective isn't advisable. We should stick with our primary mission.
Krannus = too important // Jedi + T7 = running out of time
You're a Jedi--you can't turn your back on this!
Pak is right. I can't let good men and women die.
We have to help.
You can secure the prototypes and still catch up with Krannus. I know it.
I can't put the entire galaxy at risk.
I'm sorry. I can't help.
Clean it up yourselves. The Republic didn't even want the Jedi to know this prison existed.
Not my problem.
You think they had any say in that?
I'll go deal with those prototypes myself. You just get to the research vault and save Doctor Gantrell.
